Element.Text: 1.If the patient felt dizzy, fainted or weak when he stood up?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 2.If the patient tumbled due to faint or amaurosis?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 3.If the patient dozed or fell asleep in daytime (when in the meeting, dinning, watching TV or reading)

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 4.If the activities in daytime were affected due to patient's fatigue or lack of energy?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 5.If the patient had difficulty in falling asleep or constant sleep?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 6. If the patient would like to stretch legs or relax legs after sitting or lying for a long time?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 7. If the patient had lost interest in surroundings?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 8.If the patient had lost interest in activities or starting a new activity?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 9.If the patient felt nervous, worried or afraid without any obvious reasons?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 10.If the patient looked sad and depressed?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 11. If the patient was in flat mood, no normal excitement or depression?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 12. If the patient was hard to feel interest or lack of interest in daily activities?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 13. If the patient indicated any illusion?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 14.If the patient had any delusion such as being hurt, robbed or treated unfairly?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain
1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 16.If the patient felt hard to focus in activities?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 17.If the patient forgot to do something (including taking medicines or turn off the household appliances)?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 18. If the patient was unconcious or confused about ongoing things (not including in sleeping conditions)?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 19. If the patient drooled in daytime?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 20. if the patient had the difficulty of swallow?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 21.If the patient had the problem of comstipation (less than three times a week)

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 22. If the patient felt hard to stop urgent urination

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 23.Ifthe patient's urethral gap is less than two hours?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: If the patient frequently urinated at night?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 25.If the patient changed the interest in sex? (dramatic increase or decrese)

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 26.If the patient had difficulty in sex

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 27.If the patient suffered from pain caused by other diseases?( is the pain related to medication or can be relieved by anti-Pakinson disease medications )?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 28.If the patient complained about any changes in taste or smell?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 29. If the patient felt any changes in weight (not affected by dinning)

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

Element.Text: 30. If the patient sweated too much?

Item.Text: 1 Mild: Symptoms but minor pain and annoyance to the patient
2 Moderate: Symptoms lead to more distress and life disorders
3 Severity: Symptoms become the main cause of patients'distress and pain

XTextDocument.BodyText:
Nanjing Duchang Technology Hospital Pakinson Disease Non-Motor Symptom Scale Name： Sex： Age： Inpatient No： Item Degree of soverity How often Multiply 1.Cardiovascular system（including tumbling） 1.If the patient felt dizzy, fainted or weak when he stood up? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 2.If the patient tumbled due to faint or amaurosis? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 2.Sleep and fatigue 3.If the patient dozed or fell asleep in daytime (when in the meeting, dinning, watching TV or reading) 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 4.If the activities in daytime were affected due to patient's fatigue or lack of energy? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 5.If the patient had difficulty in falling asleep or constant sleep? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 6. If the patient would like to stretch legs or relax legs after sitting or lying for a long time? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 3.Emotion and cognition 7. If the patient had lost interest in surroundings? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 8.If the patient had lost interest in activities or starting a new activity? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 9.If the patient felt nervous, worried or afraid without any obvious reasons? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 10.If the patient looked sad and depressed? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 11. If the patient was in flat mood, no normal excitement or depression? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 12. If the patient was hard to feel interest or lack of interest in daily activities? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 4. Illusion and delusion 13. If the patient indicated any illusion? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 14.If the patient had any delusion such as being hurt, robbed or treated unfairly? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 15.If the patient had diplopia? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 5.Attention and memory 16.If the patient felt hard to focus in activities? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 17.If the patient forgot to do something (including taking medicines or turn off the household appliances)? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 18. If the patient was unconcious or confused about ongoing things (not including in sleeping conditions)? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 6. Digestive tract 19. If the patient drooled in daytime? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 20. if the patient had the difficulty of swallow? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 21.If the patient had the problem of comstipation (less than three times a week) 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 7.Urinary system
22. If the patient felt hard to stop urgent urination 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 23.Ifthe patient's urethral gap is less than two hours? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 24.If the patient frequently urinated at night? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 8.Sexual function 25.If the patient changed the interest in sex? (dramatic increase or decrese) 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 26.If the patient had difficulty in sex 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 9.Other aspects 27.If the patient suffered from pain caused by other diseases?( is the pain related to medication or can be relieved by anti-Pakinson disease medications )? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 28.If the patient complained about any changes in taste or smell? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 29. If the patient felt any changes in weight (not affected by dinning) 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points 30. If the patient sweated too much? 0 No such symptoms 0 No frequency 0points Total： 0points
